Ord. #09-038)
Article I Auctioneer
Section 12-101 Definition. "Auctioneer" when used in this Article shall mean any person who sells
real estate or personal property at public or private auction for another or for himself or herself,
regardless of who owns such property.
Section 12-102 License Required. No person shall conduct an auction or engage in the business of
an auctioneer in the Village without first having obtained a license therefor.
It shall also be unlawful for any employee of an auctioneer to conduct an auction in the Village
without first having obtained a license therefor, and it shall be unlawful for any auctioneer to permit
an auction to be conducted by an unlicensed employee. Not more than two employees of an
auctioneer may be authorized by such auctioneer and licensed hereunder to conduct auctions on his
or her behalf if such person meets the prerequisites of a licensee hereunder, and such auctioneer's
license shall constitute a license for such named person.
Section 12-103 Application. An application for an auctioneer's license shall be made in conformity
with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses. An auctioneer shall
use the same application form in obtaining a license for not more than two of his or her employees by
stating in such application, in addition to the other information required, the name and residence
address of any employee who is to be authorized by the applicant to conduct auctions on applicant's
behalf.
Ord. #06-078)
Section 12-104 Fee. The annual license fee for an auctioneer's license shall be $115 plus $35 for
each employee of the auctioneer. The daily license fee for an auctioneer's license shall be $12 plus
12 for each employee of the auctioneer. No daily license fee shall be required if an annual license is
obtained, and no annual license shall be required if a daily license is obtained.
Section 12-105 Licensed Employee. All the provisions of this Code relating to an auctioneer shall
apply equally to any licensed employee of an auctioneer, and should any licensed employee of an
auctioneer violate any provisions of this Code concerning auctioneers, such licensed employee shall
be subject to all the penalties herein imposed upon licensed auctioneers for violating any of the
provisions of this Article.
If any licensed auctioneer shall permit any person other than an authorized and licensed employee to
conduct an auction on his or her behalf, the auctioneer shall be deemed guilty of a violation of this
Article. In addition, his or her license shall be revoked and no other license shall be issued to him or
her for a period of one year.
Section 12-106 Terms of Sale. It shall be the duty of every auctioneer, before beginning any
auction sale of real or personal property of any kind whatever, to state fully the terms and conditions
upon which the sale will be made and to announce to the persons present the character, quality and
description of the property offered for sale.
Section 12-107 False Representations. No auctioneer or person being present when any real or
personal property is offered for sale shall knowingly, with intent to induce any person to purchase
the same or any part thereof, make any false representations or statement as to the ownership of, or
the character or quality of, the property so offered for sale, or as to the poverty or circumstances of
the owner or pretended owner of such property; and if such false representation is made by the
auctioneer, or by any other person with such auctioneer's knowledge and consent or connivance, the
license of such auctioneer shall be revoked.
MERCHANTS
12-6 REVISED 01/03/19
Section 12-108 Substitution. No auctioneer shall exhibit and offer for sale at auction any article
and induce its purchase by any bidder, and then afterward substitute any article in lieu of that offered
to and purchased by the bidder.
Section 12-109 Fictitious Bids. No auctioneer shall procure any person to make a fictitious bid, or
shall conspire with any person to make a fictitious bid, or shall fictitiously raise any bids at any
auction sale of real or personal property.
Ord. #06-078)
Section 12-110 Special Permit for Auction Sales. No licensed auctioneer shall sell or offer for
sale at public auction any real or personal property at or in any place, house, store or building, other
than in the place, house, store or building designated in his or her license and where he or she is
authorized to act as auctioneer, except upon a special permit therefor issued bythe Village Manager.
An application for a special permit shall be made in writing to the Village Manager, setting forth the
place at which he or she desires to conduct an auction, the number of days to be occupied in making
such sale or conducting such auction and a schedule of property to be sold at such auction sale. If a
special permit is issued by the Village Manager, the applicant therefor shall pay to the Finance
Director, at or before the delivery of the special permit, a fee of $6 per day for each day or part of a
day such sale shall occupy. No special permit shall be issued to any person except a licensed
auctioneer. The special permit shall be valid only for the sale of the particular property described in
the application therefor, and at the particular time and place stated therein. Anyrenewal, addition or
substitution of property, or change of time or place for such sale, shall be unlawful.
Section 12-111 Transfer of License. No license granted under the provisions of this Article shall
be transferred to another person.
Section 12-112 Auctions on Public Ways. No real or personal property shall be sold at auction, or
exposed for sale, by any person in any public way in the Village.
Section 12-113 Exemptions. Nothing in this Article shall apply to any public auction or sale made
or conducted by a public officer by virtue of any jurisdictional order or process or by virtue of any
power or authority contained in a mortgage or trust deed.
Ord. #09-038)
Article II Tobacco Dealers
Ord. #96-004, #14-009, # 18-027, #19-003)
Section 12-201 Definitions. For the purposes of this Article, the following words have the
definitions listed:
a. Alternative Nicotine Product. A product or device not consisting of or containing tobacco
that provides for the ingestion into the body of nicotine, whether by chewing, smoking,
absorbing, dissolving, inhaling, snorting, sniffing or by any other means. This does not
include tobacco products as that term is defined in this Section or any product approved by
the United States Food and Drug Administration as a non-tobacco product for sale as a
tobacco cessation product, as a tobacco dependence product, or for other medicinal purposes.
b. Cigarette-vending machine. Any mechanical container or device used or intended to be used
for retail sales of cigarettes, the operation of which is governed or controlled by the deposit
of a coin or token.
ARLINGTON HEIGHTS MUNICIPAL CODE
12-7 REVISED 01/03/19
c. Electronic Smoking Devices. Adevice as defined by federal, state, or nationally recognized
health organizations which device is capable of providing nicotine or any other substances
through vapor or inhalation. This device shall be considered a tobacco product for purposes
of this Municipal Code.
d. False Identification. Any document used for identification or proof of age that has been
altered or defaced or that contains false or misleading information or that contains a name
that is not the actual name of the person using it.
e. Minor. Any person under the age of 21 years.
f. Operator. Any person who owns a cigarette-vending machine and who consigns such
machine for use and undertakes to maintain it in proper operating condition and keep it
supplied with such cigarettes as are ordered by the retail tobacco dealer while on
consignment to him or her.
g. Owner. Includes an operator or retail tobacco dealer who has acquired possession and
exclusive control of a cigarette-vending machine by purchase, lease or otherwise.
h. Retail tobacco dealer. Any person selling, offering for sale, exposing for sale or keeping,
with the intention of selling or exchanging at retail, cigarettes, cigars or tobacco in any form.
i. Tobacco products. Any substance containing tobacco leaf, including but not limited to,
cigarettes, cigars, pipe tobacco, snuff, chewing tobacco or dipping tobacco.
Section 12-202 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of a retail tobacco dealer
in the Village, without first having obtained a license therefor; provided, however, that no such
license will be required of a retail tobacco dealer who makes no over-the-counter sales of cigarettes,
cigars or tobacco in any form, but merely permits the sale of cigarettes from cigarette-vending
machines located on his or her premises which are all properly registered and for which registration
stickers have been purchased as hereinafter provided.
Section 12-203 Application. An application for a retail tobacco dealer's license shall be made in
conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses.
Ord. #05-020, #06-078)
Section 12-204 Fee. The annual fee for a retail tobacco dealer's license shall be based on the
standardized calculation fee schedule located in Section 14-102, License Required, of this Code, plus
105 for each cigarette-vending machine in excess of one which is located on the premises of the
retail tobacco dealer and which is not properly registered and for which a registration sticker has not
been purchased by the owner of such machine as hereinafter provided.
Section 12-205 Transfer of License. The transfer of any license issued hereunder is hereby
expressly prohibited.
Section 12-206 Sanitary and Health Requirements. It shall be the duty of all persons licensed
hereunder, upon the demand of the Health Services Director, to furnish for inspection samples of all
cigarettes, cigars or tobacco in any form sold or offered for sale by them, and it shall be the duty of
such person to keep their premises and buildings in a clean and sanitary condition. No person shall
expose for sale, sell or offer for sale to any person, directly or indirectly, within the Village, any
cigarettes, cigars or tobacco in any form containing opium, morphine, jimson weed, belladonna,
strychnia, cocaine or any other poisonous or deleterious drug or drugs.
MERCHANTS
12-8 REVISED 01/03/19
The Director of Building shall cause to be inspected and examined, as often as deemed necessary, all
places where cigarettes, cigars or tobacco in any form are licensed to be sold at retail within the
Village, and all such cigarettes, cigars or tobacco, to determine whether all applicable laws of the
State and provisions of this Code are being complied with.
Ord. #96-004, #98-011, # 02-009, #14-009, # 18-027, #19-003)
Section 12-207 Prohibition of Sales to, Purchase by and Possession by Minors.
a. Possession. It shall be unlawful for any person under the age of 18 years to possess any
tobacco products, alternative nicotine products or electronic smoking devices.
b. Sales or delivery. It shall be unlawful for any person to sell, offer to sell, give away or deliver
tobacco products, alternative nicotine products or electronic smoking devices to any person
under 21 years of age. It shall be unlawful for any licensee or any officer, associate, member,
representative, agent or employee of such licensee to engage, employ or permit any person
under the age of 18 years of age to sell tobacco products, alternative nicotine products or
electronic smoking devices in any licensed premises.
c. Purchase. It shall be unlawful for any person under the age of 21 years to purchase tobacco
products, alternative nicotine products or electronic smoking devices to misrepresent their
identity or age or to use false identification for the purpose of purchasing tobacco products,
alternative nicotine products or electronic smoking devices.
d. Signs required. Signs informing the public of the age restrictions provided for in this Section
shall be posted by every retail tobacco dealer at or near every display of tobacco products,
alternative nicotine products or electronic smoking devices and on or upon every vending
machine which offers tobacco products, alternative nicotine products or electronic smoking
devices for sale. Posted signs shall be plainly visible and shall measure at least 8-1/2 inches
by 11 inches. Lettering on posted signs shall be at least one- inch in height. Each sign shall
be plainly visible and shall state:
THE SALE OF TOBACCO PRODUCTS, ALTERNATIVE NICOTINE
PRODUCTS OR ELECTRONIC SMOKING DEVICES TOPERSONS
UNDER 21 YEARS OF AGE IS PROHIBITED BY LAW.
e. Penalties. Retail tobacco dealers engaging in the conduct prohibited by this Section may be
subject to license suspension or revocation, in accordance with the applicable provisions of
Chapter 9, General Licensing Procedure, concerning revocation and suspension of business
licenses. Additionally, any person violating any provisions of this Section shall be subject to
prosecution and a fine of not less than $ 5 nor more than $ 750.
f. Enforcement at schools. The extent of enforcement of violations of this Section occurring on
school property shall be within the discretion of the school officials.
Ord. #02-009, #19-003)
Section 12-208 Prohibition of Sales by Self- Service. It shall be unlawful to sell, offer for sale,
give away or display tobacco products for sale at any location where the consumer can acquire those
products through self- service. All tobacco products must be displayed from behind a
sales/ service counter so that no consumer can access tobacco products without assistance from an
employee of the licensee.
ARLINGTON HEIGHTS MUNICIPAL CODE
12-9 REVISED 01/03/19
This prohibition shall not apply to those retailers who are primarily engaged in the business of selling
tobacco products. There shall be no persons under the age of 21 permitted in such business unless
they are employees.
Section 12-209 Sales Near Schools. No person shall sell, give away, barter, exchange or otherwise
deal in any cigarettes, cigars or tobacco in any form at any place located within 100 feet of any
building used exclusively for school purposes; provided, however, that this Section shall not apply to
retail tobacco dealers who were licensed to conduct business at their present fixed location prior to
the effective date of this Code.
Ord. #02-009)
Section 12-210 Annual Registration of Cigarette and Cigar Vending Machines. Only non-selfservice
cigarette and cigar vending machines shall be permitted. Before any cigarette vending
machine or cigar vending machine may be installed for use and, thereafter, annually before January
15, it shall be registered as hereinafter provided.
Section 12-211 Application for Registration. Application for a registration sticker for each
cigarette-vending machine shall be filed in the office of the Director of Building by the owner,
stating the owner’ s name and address, the name of the makes of such machine and factory number
thereof, the name of the retail tobacco dealer for whose use it is to be installed, and the street address
of the premises in which it is to be used.
Section 12-212 Approval of Application. The original application shall be referred to the Police
Chief for investigation and verification of the facts stated therein and the business methods of the
owner. The Police Chief may recommend that the application be denied if the investigation reveals
that the owner has been convicted of a criminal offense, or violated any law or ordinance imposing
any cigarette excise tax, or, if the owner is an operator, that he or she has employed coercive or
illegal measures to promote the use of the cigarette-vending machine or to promote the sale of any
brands of cigarettes, or that the place where the cigarette-vending machine is to be used and the
person in control thereof is not qualified under the provisions of this Article. In such circumstance,
the Police Chief shall return the application to the Director of Building with a statement of the
reasons for refusing approval of the application. Otherwise, the Police Chief shall return the
application with approval noted. If the owner is a firm, corporation, partnership or association, the
application shall not be approved if the Police Chief shall find that any member, officer, director or
manager of such firm, corporation, partnership or association, or any stockholder owning more than
5% of the stock of such corporation, would not be eligible for a certificate of registration if he or she
were the sole owner.
Section 12-213 Registration Sticker. Upon approval of the application by the Police Chief and
payment of the annual registration fee to the Village, the Director of Building shall issue a
registration sticker. The registration sticker shall be affixed to the cigarette-vending machine so as to
be clearly visible when in use.
Ord. #04-077, #06-078)
Section 12-214 Registration Fee. A fee of $105 for each machine shall be paid for each
registration sticker and no proration of the fee will be permitted regardless of when application is
MERCHANTS
12-10 REVISED 10/05/09
made for the sticker. The sticker shall be valid from the date of issue until December 31 of the
calendar year in which it is issued.
Ord. #09-038)
Article III Solid Fuel and Fuel Oil Dealers
Section 12-301 Definitions. Solid fuel means any anthracite, semi-anthracite, bituminous, semibituminous,
or ignite coal, briquettes, boulets, coke, gas-house coke, petroleum coke, petroleum
carbon, firewood or any other manufactured or patented fuel not sold by liquid or metered measure.
Dealer in solid fuel means any person offering for sale, selling, delivering, or dealing and delivering
any solid fuel.
Fuel oil dealer means any person whose primary business is the storage of fuel oil or petroleum in
bulk for the purpose of sale, or whose primary business is the conveyance of fuel oil or petroleum in
any vehicle for the purpose of sale.
Fuel oil storer means any person who keeps on hand or stores fuel oil for use in any business, but not
for resale.
Section 12-302 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of coal yard owner or
dealer in solid fuel or fuel oil dealer within the Village without first having obtained a license
therefor. No person shall keep on hand or store fuel oil for use in any business in the Village, other
than the business of fuel oil dealer, without first having obtained a license therefor for each location,
place or premise where such person keeps on hand or stores for use any such oil; provided, however,
that no license shall be required of any person who keeps on hand or stores fuel oil at any location,
place or premise in a quantity less than 2000 gallons for use exclusively in the heating of any
building.
Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Section, any person engaging or proposing to engage
in one or more of the businesses or activities described in this Article shall obtain a separate license
for each.
Section 12-303 Application. An application for any license under this Article shall be made in
conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses. The
application shall also set forth whether the applicant engages in or proposes to engage in the business
or activity of coal yard owner, dealer in solid fuel, fuel oil dealer or fuel oil storer.
The application for a coal yard owner's license or solid fuel dealer’ s license shall also set forth the
number of vehicles, if any, to be used in connection with the business.
An application for a fuel oil dealer's license shall also state whether the applicant uses or proposes to
use storage facilities in connection with the business of fuel oil dealer and, if so, the location, place
or premise where such storage facilities are located or are to be located, their capacity and the
number of vehicles, if any, to be used in connection with the business.
An application for a fuel oil storer's license shall also state the location of the place at which the
applicant desires or intends to store fuel oil for use in the applicant's business, the maximum
ARLINGTON HEIGHTS MUNICIPAL CODE
11 REVISED 10/05/09
aggregate quantity to be so stored or used, a description of the business engaged in, the location and
capacity of all containers or tanks having a capacity of 50 gallons or more for the storage of fuel oil,
and such other information as may be required by the Chief of the Fire Department.
Ord. #04-077)
Section 12-304 Fee. The annual fee for a solid fuel dealer's license shall be $130 for each separate
place of business operated or conducted by the licensee within the Village plus $25 for each vehicle,
if any, owned, hired or rented by the licensee and used in connection with the business. The annual
license fee for a fuel oil or bulk petroleum dealer's license shall be $400. The annual fee for a fuel
oil storer's license shall be based on the total capacity of the containers and tanks for the storage of
fuel oil located in and upon each separate location, place or premise where the licensee stores fuel oil
for use in the business, as follows:
Not to exceed 200 gallons $ 25
Over 200 gallons but not exceeding 1,065 gallons $ 30
Over 1,065 gallons but not exceeding 10,600 gallons $ 50
Over 10,600 gallons but not exceeding 15,600 gallons $ 65
Over 15,600 gallons $ 65 plus $ 7 for each one
thousand gallons or fraction
thereof in excess of 15,600
gallons; provided, however,
that the maximum annual
license fee hereunder shall not
exceed $525
Section 12-305 Fire Limits. It shall be unlawful to store fuel oil as a fuel oil dealer within the fire
limits of the Village, and no license shall be issued for the storage of any such fuel oil.
Section 12-306 Piling Solid Fuel. It shall be unlawful to pile any solid fuel in such a way that it
can fall on adjoining property or upon any street, alley, sidewalk or other public place.
Section 12-307 Zoning. The provisions of this Article shall not be construed to permit the
establishment of any storage facility in any place where a storage facility is prohibited by the zoning
regulations of this Code.
Section 12-308 Regulations Relating to Dealers in Solid Fuel and Storers of Solid Fuel. No
solid fuel shall be stored for sale in the same building with fuel oil, gasoline or other flammable
liquids unless separated therefrom by a fireproof wall. It shall be unlawful for any person to deliver
or attempt to deliver to a purchaser any kind, grade or size of solid fuel other than that advertised by
the seller, ordered by the purchaser or specified on the delivery ticket or weighmaster's certificate.
Every licensee, selling or offering for sale solid fuel by weight from a vehicle upon the public ways
of the Village in quantities less than 500 pounds, shall equip such vehicle with a scale capable of
weighing 100 pounds.
Whenever solid fuel in storage shows indication of spontaneous ignition or gives off gases, it shall be
the duty of the licensee, agent or person in charge or control of the premises to turn over such solid
fuel and remove all portions of the same showing indication of ignition or coking. The floor
MERCHANTS
12 REVISED 10/05/09
or ground surface of all solid fuel storage yards shall at all times be kept free from flammable waste
material and accumulations of combustible waste materials.
Section 12-309 Regulations Relating to Fuel Oil Dealers and Fuel Oil Storers. All places of
business of fuel oil dealers and fuel oil storers shall be kept in a clean condition, free from
accumulations of rags, waste paper and other combustible waste material. Rags, waste paper and
other combustible waste materials shall be kept in metal containers pending removal from the
premises. No person shall smoke on the place of business of a fuel oil dealer or in that part of any
premises where fuel oil is stored.
All containers or tanks used for the storage of fuel oil and all buildings and premises where fuel oil is
stored shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with the applicable provisions of this Code,
and the licensee's activities shall comply with all applicable regulations.
It shall be unlawful for any fuel oil dealer or fuel oil storer to refill any fuel oil storage container or
tank used in connection with an oil burning heater, boiler or furnace unless such storage container or
tank is equipped with an automatic or return vent pipe, or unless the fill pipe of such storage
container or tank is equipped with a screw or automatic cap. It shall be the duty of every such dealer
and storer, after filling or refilling any fuel oil storage container or tank, to replace the screw cap on
such fill pipe, or if equipped with an automatic cap, to see that the fill cap is properly closed.
Section 12-310 Inspections. The Fire Chief shall cause to be inspected, as often as deemed
necessary, all premises, vehicles, containers and tanks, either above or below ground or within a
building, to determine whether all applicable provisions of this Code are being complied with.
Section 12-311 Fire Prevention Regulations. Any person licensed under this Article shall be
subject to all applicable fire regulations of this Code and to all penalties for violations thereof.
Nothing in any of these sections shall be construed as limiting any of the fire prevention regulations
of this Code.
Ord. #09-038)
Article IV Florists
Section 12-401 Definition. The term "florist" when used in this Article shall mean any person
regularly engaged in the conduct of an established business for selling, at retail or wholesale, cut
flowers, bridal bouquets, funeral floral designs or growing plants from a fixed and permanent
business location.
Section 12-402 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of retail florist or
wholesale florist in the Village without first having obtained a license therefor. A person who is
engaged in more than one such business shall procure a separate license for each. In addition, a
separate license shall be required for each location, place or premise where the person is located to
engage in business.
It is unlawful to engage in the business of an itinerant retail or wholesale florist in the Village, and
such activities are hereby prohibited.
ARLINGTON HEIGHTS MUNICIPAL CODE
13 REVISED 10/05/09
Section 12-403 Application. An application for any license under this Article shall be made in
conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses. The
application shall also indicate whether the applicant desires to engage in the business of retail florist
or wholesale florist.
Section 12-404 Sanitary Regulations. Every location, place or establishment where the business
of a florist is conducted, managed or carried on shall be kept in a clean and sanitary condition and
free from vermin. No decayed, decaying, unwholesome, contaminated or diseased flowers or plants
shall be allowed to remain in or about such establishment. Adequate and convenient washing and
toilet facilities shall be provided.
No licensee shall sell or offer for sale any flowers or plants the sale of which is restricted by Federal
or State law.
Section 12-405 Inspection. The Director of Building shall inspect, as often as deemed necessary,
all florist establishments to determine whether the provisions of this Code relating to health,
sanitation and safety applicable thereto are being complied with.
Section 12-406 Off Premises Sales Prohibited. No license shall be issued except for a fixed
location. The sale of flowers, plants or floral bouquets or designs on the public way or at places
other than those at which the licensee is licensed is hereby prohibited.
Ord. #09-038)
Article V Ice Dealers
Section 12-501 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of a retail ice dealer
without first having obtained a license therefor. The term " retail ice dealer" for purposes of this
Section shall include the owner or operator of an ice-vending machine, but shall not include the
owner of the premises where the machine is located unless either the owner of the premises is also
the owner or operator of the machine; or the owner of the premises also engages in the retail sale of
ice other than through the machine; or the owner or operator of the machine has not paid the license
fee required.
Section 12-502 Application. An application for a retail ice dealer's license shall be made in
conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses. In
addition, the application shall set forth the number of ice-vending machines owned or operated by
the applicant in the Village, the maker of such machine and factory numbers thereof, the name of the
owner of the premises on which they are to be installed, and the street address of such premises.
Article VI Junk Dealers
Section 12-601 Definitions. The following terms shall have the meanings set forth below for
purposes of this Chapter.
1. Fence. Any place for the purchase, reception or keeping of stolen goods.
2. Junk. Includes old iron, chain, brass, copper, tin, lead or other base metals, old rope, old
bags, rags, waste paper, paper clippings, scraps of woolens, clips, bagging, rubber and
MERCHANTS
14
glass, empty bottles of different kinds and sizes when the number of each kind or size is less than
one gross, and all articles and things discarded or no longer used as a manufactured article
composed of, or consisting of, any one or more of the materials or articles herein mentioned.
3. Junk Dealer. Every person that shall engage at a junk store in the business of buying, selling,
bartering or exchanging, or that shall collect, receive, store or hold in possession for sale,
barter or exchange any of the things defined herein as junk, whether dealer at wholesale or at
retail.
4. Junk Store. Any store, shop, warehouse or building in the Village where junk is bought, sold,
bartered or exchanged, or where junk is collected, received, stored or held in possession for
resale, barter or exchange, either at wholesale or retail.
5. Junk Yard. Any yard, place or enclosure other than a junk store as herein defined, where junk
is bought, sold, bartered or exchanged either at wholesale or retail, or where junk is collected,
received, stored or held in possession for resale, barter or exchange, either at wholesale or
retail.
Section 12-602 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of junk dealer without
first having obtained a license.
Section 12-603 Application. An application for a license under this Article shall be made in
conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses.
Section 12-604 Junk Yards. It shall be unlawful to maintain a junkyard anywhere in the Village.
Section 12-605 Stolen Goods. Every junk dealer who shall receive or be in possession of any
goods, articles, things or junk which may have been lost or stolen, or are alleged or supposed to have
been lost or stolen, shall, on demand, exhibit them to any member of the Police Department for
examination.
Section 12-606 Minors. No junk dealer shall purchase any article whatsoever from any person
under 21 years of age without the written consent of a parent or guardian of such person under a
penalty of not less than $1 nor more than $50 for each offense.
Section 12-607 Fences. No person shall keep, maintain or conduct a place for the purchase,
reception or keeping of stolen goods as a " fence".
Section 12-608 Identity of Junk Received. No article, thing or substance included within any junk
purchased, received or collected at retail shall be melted, vulcanized or otherwise changed or its
identity destroyed within two days after the same was purchased, received or collected.
Section 12-609 Restrictions on Sales. No retail junk dealer shall expose for sale, or sell or dispose
of any goods, article, junk or thing whatsoever within two days of the time of purchasing, receiving
or collecting the same, nor until the same have been in the premises wherein the same are offered,
exposed or sold at least two days; provided, that a junk peddler may dispose of junk collected in bulk
sales from day to day to a retail junk dealer whose duty it is to hold such purchases for two days in
conformity with the provisions of this Article.
ARLINGTON HEIGHTS MUNICIPAL CODE
15 REVISED 10/05/09
Section 12-610 Prohibited Activities. No junk dealer shall receive any article or thing by way of
pledge or pawn; nor shall such dealer loan or advance any sum of money on the security of any
article or thing. No person licensed as a junk dealer shall receive or hold a license to conduct the
business of a pawnbroker or second-hand dealer.
Section 12-611 Inspection. The places of business and all junk of every junk dealer shall, at all
reasonable times, be open to the inspection of any member of the Police Department. Whenever
there shall be filed with the Police Chief, by the owner or agent of the owner, a sworn written
statement that such owner or such agent has reason to believe that certain stolen goods or things
specifically described in the sworn statement are in the possession of any junk dealer, anymember of
the Police Department shall have the right to inspect the premises of the junk dealer at any
reasonable hour and view all junk which has been purchased, received, collected or stored in the
premises occupied by such business.
Ord. #09-038)
Article VII Lumber and Wood Dealers
Section 12-701 Definitions. The terms "lumber yard" and "lumber storehouse" when used in this
Article shall mean any place used for the storage of lumber, wooden containers or wood (except
firewood) in an amount exceeding five thousand board feet.
Section 12-702 License Required. No person shall conduct, establish or operate a lumberyard or
lumber storehouse in the Village without first having obtained a license therefor.
Section 12-703 Application. An application for a license shall be made in conformity with the
general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses.
Section 12-704 Fire Limits. No lumber yard or lumber storehouse shall be established or licensed
within the fire limits of the Village; but this Section shall not be construed to require the removal of
any lumber yard or lumber storehouse which is already located and established.
Section 12-705 Fire Apparatus. It shall be the duty of every person owning or operating a
lumberyard or lumber storehouse to have the same equipped with sufficient fire apparatus to put out
and prevent from spreading any small fires which may start.
Section 12-706 Fire Prevention Regulations. Any person that shall conduct or operate a
lumberyard or lumber storehouse shall be subject to all applicable fire regulations of this Code and to
all penalties for violations thereof.
Section 12-707 Piling Lumber. It shall be unlawful to pile any lumber in a lumberyard or lumber
storehouse in such a way that the lumber is hanging over or is in danger of falling onto any adjoining
property, street, alley or public way.
Section 12-708 Inspections. The Director of Building and the Fire Chief shall cause to be
inspected as often as deemed necessary, every lumberyard and lumber storehouse in the Village to
determine whether all applicable provisions of this Code are being complied with.
MERCHANTS
16 REVISED 10/05/09
Ord. #09-038)
Article VIII Pawnbrokers
Section 12-801 Definition. Pawnbroker, when used in this Article, means any person engaged in
the business of receiving property in pledge or as security for money or other thing advanced to the
pawner or pledger.
Ord. #09-038)
Section 12-802 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of pawnbroker within
the Village without first having obtained a license therefor. No person shall conduct or operate a
pawnbroker business without first having obtained a license from the State of Illinois, pursuant to the
provisions of the applicable laws.
Ord. #09-038)
Section 12-803 Application. An application for a pawnbroker's license shall be made in conformity
with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses. It shall be
accompanied by a copy of a valid license issued by the State of Illinois.
Ord. #04-077, #06-078)
Section 12-804 Fee. The annual fee for a pawnbroker's license shall be $215.
Section 12-805 Records. Every pawnbroker doing business in the Village shall keep a record of
every article pledged or received, purchased, sold or exchanged, setting forth the following: the date
of the transaction, name and address of the pledger, purchaser or seller, and a brief description of the
article pledged, sold, purchased, received or exchanged, including identification number thereon, if
any. Such record and the articles themselves shall at all reasonable times be open to the inspection
of any police officer.
Section 12-806 Weapons. No pawnbroker shall receive as a pledge or purchase any revolver,
pistol, blackjack or sawed-off shotgun. No pawnbroker shall display in a window or shop any such
weapons for sale.
Section 12-807 Prohibited Pledges and Purchases. No pawnbroker's license shall be issued to any
person who is under 21 years of age, and no pawnbroker shall employ a person who is under 21 years
of age. No pawnbroker shall have any business dealings with any person under 21 years of age,
except upon the written consent of the parent or guardian of such person to each particular
transaction. No pawnbroker shall take any article in pawn or buy from any person appearing to be
intoxicated, nor from any person known to be a thief or to have been convicted of larceny or burglary
and when any person is found to be the owner of stolen property which has been pawned or bought,
such property shall be returned to the owner thereof without the payment of the amount advanced by
the pawnbroker thereon or any costs or charges of any kind which the pawnbroker may have placed
upon the same.
Section 12-808 Stolen Goods. It shall be the duty of every pawnbroker to report to the police any
article pledged, or sought to be pledged, if the pawnbroker has reason to believe that the article was
stolen or lost.
Section 12-809 Interest Charges. It shall be unlawful for any pawnbroker to charge or collect a
greater benefit or percentage upon money advanced and for the use and forbearance thereof than the
rate of 3% per month; provided, however, that nothing herein shall be so construed as to
ARLINGTON HEIGHTS MUNICIPAL CODE
17 REVISED 10/05/09
conflict with the law pertaining to usury; and the person receiving money so advanced shall not be
held to pay any storage insurance or charges other than such interest as herein provided. Every
pawnbroker shall at all times have and keep the above paragraph printed in the English language,
framed and posted in a prominent and conspicuous position in the place of business, so that the
provisions of this Code shall be plainly legible and visible to all persons depositing or pledging
property with such pawnbrokers.
Section 12-810 Second-Hand Dealers. No pawnbroker shall engage in the business of a secondhand
dealer, as licensed by other provisions of this Code, without first having obtained a secondhand
dealer's license in addition to a pawnbroker's license. No pawnbroker shall engage in the
business of a junk dealer.
Article IX Brokers
Section 12-901 Definitions. For the purposes of this Article, general broker means any person,
other than an employee of the principal for whom the business is done, that negotiates, buys, sells,
trades, leases or handles for another, on a commission basis, or on the basis of compensation in
proportion to the amount of the transaction, any stocks, bonds, mortgages, loans, investment
securities, certificates of indebtedness, foreign exchange letters of credit, grain, provisions, produce,
livestock, goods, wares, merchandise or any other commodity, article or property ( except real
property), whether similar or dissimilar to those herein mentioned, or acts through the medium of
another licensed broker in the capacity and for any of the purposes aforesaid. This term does not
include insurance brokers or real estate brokers.
Section 12-902 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of, or act in the capacity
of or hold himself or herself out as a general broker without first having obtained a license.
Section 12-903 Application. An application for any license required by this Article shall be made
in conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses.
Section 12-904 Business at More than One Place. Where a person desires to engage in the
business of a general broker at more than one place within the Village, a separate license shall be
required for each of such places, and the full license fee as herein fixed shall be charged for each
such license issued.
Section 12-905 Employees Acting as Brokers. Any person employed by a person licensed as a
general broker under the provisions of this Article, who shall, on his or her own account and not as
such employee, engage in the business or act in the capacity of a general broker must obtain a
license, notwithstanding the fact of such employment.
Article X Peddlers and Solicitors
Section 12-1001 Definitions. For the purposes of this Article, the following words and phrases
shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them by this Section:
a. Charitable Purpose. Any charitable, benevolent, philanthropic, patriotic, or eleemosynary
purpose.
MERCHANTS
18 REVISED 06/03/13
b. Charitable Organization. Any benevolent, philanthropic, patriotic, not-for-profit, or
eleemosynary group, association or corporation, or such organization purporting to be such,
which solicits and collects funds for charitable purposes.
c. Contribution. The promise or grant of any money or property of any kind of value, including
payment for literature in excess of the fair market value of the literature.
d. Peddler. Any person who, going from place to place, shall at retail sell, offer for sale, sell
and deliver, barter or exchange any goods, wares, merchandise, wood, oil, fish, fruits,
vegetables, country produce or any other article or thing whatsoever or any service from a
vehicle or otherwise. It shall not include a serviceman who, responding to a prior call, sells
replacement merchandise.
e. Solicitor. Any person who, going from place to place, without prior appointment or prearrangement
with the customer, shall take orders for future delivery at retail of any
merchandise or other article or thing, or any service or any person who solicits and collects
funds for charitable purposes.
Ord. #98-001, #13-028)
Section 12-1002 Permit Required. No person shall engage in the business of a peddler or solicitor
within the Village without first having obtained a permit; provided, however, that the classes of
peddlers engaging in businesses specifically defined and licensed by other provisions of this Code
shall be exempt from the provisions of this Article and must be licensed in accordance with those
applicable provisions of this Code.
Ord. #13-028)
Section 12-1003 Application. No one shall peddle or solicit from persons in the Village by doorto-
door solicitation or the use of public streets and public ways without first obtaining a permit.
Application for a permit shall be made to the Department of Building and Health Services and shall
include the following information:
a. The name of the organization, partnership, corporation or proprietorship for whom the
applicant works, and the name under which it intends to solicit;
b. The name, address and driver’ s license number of the person in charge of solicitation in the
Village and a telephone number of the parent firm or corporation;
c. The names, permanent addresses, birthdates and driver’ s license numbers of all persons who
will solicit in the Village;
d. The specific dates and times of day such solicitations are to be made and the specific location
within the Village where such solicitation shall be conducted at a particular time and day;
e. The number of vehicles, if any, intended to be operated and the kind of merchandise, if any,
to be peddled or offered for order;
f. If applicable, a written statement of recent date by the Attorney General of Illinois that the
organization has complied with the provisions of "An Act to Regulate Solicitation and
Collection of Funds for Charitable Purposes", 225 ILCS 460/1 et seq. as now or hereafter

amended, if the organization is subject to the statute. Astatement bythe Attorney General of
exemption under 225 ILCS 460/5 is required for religious organizations.
Ord. #96-053, #13-028)
Section 12-1004 Administrative Procedures for Application for Permit.
a. All applications shall be submitted to the Building and Health Services Department and shall
be verified under oath by a responsible officer of the soliciting organization.
The failure of an applicant to fulfill the requirements of this Article shall be the sole basis for
a denial of the permit. In the event that any permit is denied for failure to comply with the
requirements of this Article, the applicant shall immediately be notified of the reasons for
denial.
b. For door-to-door solicitors and peddlers, no permit shall be valid for more than 90 days
within any 365 days from the first date of solicitation. Each individual shall wear their
Village-issued ID card at all times while going door-to-door.
Ord. #13-028)
Section 12-1005 Solicitation Upon the Public Streets.
a. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to solicit, either in person or byagent,
upon the public streets, sidewalks or any other public place in the Village without having first
secured a permit.
b. Tag days shall be limited to two events of no more than two successive days each, for a total
of no more than four days in a 365 day period.
c. A person, firm, or corporation may be issued a permit to stand upon streets or highways
within the Village for purposes of soliciting from the occupants of vehicles; provided, that
the solicitors shall comply with the following requirements:
1. Solicitation shall occur only at intersections where all traffic is required to come to a
full stop;
2. Solicitation shall occur at highway intersections only during hours of daylight - from
one-half hour before sunrise to one-half hour after sunset;
3. Persons engaged in solicitation upon streets or highways shall be at least 16 years of
age and shall wear a high visibility vest; and
4. The soliciting agency shall provide evidence of a policy of comprehensive general
liability insurance in a form and amount satisfactory to the Village Manager prior to
the solicitation and shall be liable for any injuries to any person or property occurring
during any solicitation activity which is causally related to an act of ordinary
negligence of the soliciting agency.
Section 12-1006 Fraud. It shall be unlawful for any peddler or solicitor to cheat, deceive or
fraudulently misrepresent, whether through himself or herself or through an employee, while acting
as a peddler or solicitor in the Village, or to barter, sell or peddle any goods, merchandise or wares or
to engage in any form of solicitation other than those specified in the application for a permit.

12-20 REVISED 03/07/16
Section 12-1007 Hours of Operation. No soliciting or peddling shall be permitted before the hours
of 9:00 A.M. or after the hour of 9:00 P.M. within the Village, and no peddling or soliciting shall be
conducted on Sundays.
Ord. #14-014)
Section 12-1008 Conducting Business.
a. No peddler or solicitor maypark anywhere in the Village in a given place for longer than one
hour on any single day, and after the expiration of one hour, he or she must move on to a
different location which is at least one thousand feet away from the last location. These
limitations do not apply if a peddler or solicitor is part of a special event in which case the
peddler or solicitor may remain for the duration of the special event.
b. Each solicitor of a contribution for a charitable purpose shall distribute, upon request by the
party solicited, a financial statement of the organization for the preceding 12 months which
shall include a balance sheet and statement of income and expenses clearly setting forth the
following: gross receipts and gross income from all sources broken down into total receipts
and income from each separate solicitation project or source; cost of administration; cost of
solicitation; cost of programs designed to inform or educate the public; funds or properties
transferred out of the State of Illinois, with explanation as to recipient and purpose; total net
income amount for each major purpose, charitable or otherwise. The statement shall be
signed by the President or other authorized officer and shall be accompanied by an opinion
signed by an independent certified public accountant that the financial statement fairly
represents the financial operation of the organization in sufficient detail to permit public
evaluation of its operations.
A copy of the annual report to the Attorney General required by 225 ILCS 460/4 may be
presented in lieu of such financial statements. For the purposes of financial statements, the
definitions and standards applicable to the annual report to the Attorney General may be
utilized. In the event an organization has not been established for a period of 12 months, a
copy of the registration statement filed with the Attorney General may be utilized.
Section 12-1009 Food Peddlers. Peddlers of food shall comply with the application regulations of
Chapter 11 of this Code relating to food dealers as therein defined.
Ord. #16-004)
Section 12-1010 Notice Regulating Soliciting and Peddling. Notice of the determination of the
occupant's refusal of invitation to any solicitors or peddlers shall be given in the following manner:
A weatherproof card, at least three inches by four inches in size, shall be exhibited
upon or near the main entrance door to the residence containing words such as those
set forth below:
NO SOLICITORS OR PEDDLERS
The letters shall be at least one-third inch in height. Cards are available throughout
Village Hall at no cost. A card exhibited at a residence shall constitute sufficient
notice to any solicitor or peddler of the occupant's refusal to allow solicitors or
peddlers.
ARLINGTON HEIGHTS MUNICIPAL CODE
21 REVISED 10/05/09
Section 12-1011 Duty of Solicitors or Peddlers. It shall be the duty of every solicitor or peddler,
upon going onto any premises in the Village upon which a residence is located, to look for the notice
provided for in this Article, if any is attached, to obey the statement contained on the notice. If the
notice contains words such as "NO SOLICITORS OR PEDDLERS", then the solicitor or peddler,
whether registered or not, shall immediately and peacefully depart from the premises. Any solicitor
or peddler who has gained entrance to any residence, whether invited or not, shall immediately and
peacefully depart from the premises when requested to do so by the occupant.
Section 12-1012 Convicted Felons as Solicitors. It shall be unlawful for any organization to utilize
as a solicitor any person who has been convicted of a forcible felony within a period of five years
prior to the date of solicitation or who, having been convicted of a forcible felony, has been released
from a penal institution for a period of less than three years prior to the date of proposed solicitation.
For the purposes of this Section, a "forcible felony" means treason, murder, voluntary manslaughter,
aggravated criminal sexual assault, criminal assault, robbery, burglary, arson, kidnapping, aggravated
battery and any other felony which involves the use or threat of physical force or violence against any
individual.
Section 12-1013 Revocation. Any permit may be revoked by the Village Manager because of any
violation of this Article or any other ordinance of the Village, or any State or Federal law, or if any
solicitor is the subject of outstanding arrest warrants, or whenever the registrant shall cease to
possess the qualifications and character required in this Article for the original registration.
Section 12-1014 Penalty. Any person, firm or corporation violating the provisions of this Article
shall be fined not more than $750 for each such offense.
Ord. #09-038)
Article XI Second-Hand Dealers
Section 12-1101 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of a second-hand
dealer in the Village without having first obtained a license therefor; provided, however, that the
term "second-hand dealer" as used in this Section shall not include pawnbrokers or junk dealers as
defined and licensed by other provisions of this Code, or sales or exchanges of used articles and
materials conducted by charitable or religious organizations.
Section 12-1102 Application. An application for a second-hand dealer's license shall be made in
conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses.
Section 12-1103 Records. Every second-hand dealer doing business in the Village shall keep a
record of every article received, purchased, sold or exchanged, setting forth the following: the date
of the transaction, the name and address of the purchaser or seller, and a brief description of the
article received, purchased, sold or exchanged, including identification numbers thereon, if any.
Such record and the articles themselves shall at all reasonable times be open to the inspection of any
police officer.
Section 12-1104 Weapons. No second-hand dealer shall purchase or receive any revolver, pistol,
blackjack or sawed-off shotgun. No second-hand dealer shall display in a window or shop any such
weapons for sale.
MERCHANTS
22 REVISED 10/05/09
Section 12-1105 Prohibited Transactions. No second-hand dealer's license shall be issued to any
person who is under 21 years of age, and no second-hand dealer shall employ a person who is under
21 years of age to assist in the business. No second-hand dealer shall have any business dealings as
a second-hand dealer with any person under 21 years of age, except upon the written consent of the
parent or guardian of such person to each particular transaction.
No second-hand dealer shall purchase or receive from any person appearing to be intoxicated, nor
from any person known to be a thief or to have been convicted of larceny or burglary, and when any
person is found to be the owner of stolen property which has been purchased or received, such
property shall be returned to the owner thereof without the payment of the amount advanced by the
second-hand dealer thereon or any costs or charges of any kind which the second-hand dealer may
have placed upon the same.
Section 12-1106 Stolen Goods. It shall be the duty of every second-hand dealer to report to the
police any article received which he or she has reason to believe was lost or stolen.
Section 12-1107 Pawnbrokers. No second-hand dealer shall engage in the business of a
pawnbroker, as licensed by other provisions of this Code, without first having obtained a
pawnbroker's license in addition to a second-hand dealer's license. No second-hand dealer shall
engage in the business of a junk dealer.
Section 12-1108 Use of Unlicensed Premises. No second-hand dealer shall make use of any
property, private or public, not included within the licensed premises, for the storage, handling, or
display of any second-hand article.
Ord. #09-038)
Article XII Feed Dealers
Section 12-1201 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of keeping, offering for
sale or selling at retail any hay, straw, grain or mill feed of any nature or description without first
having obtained a license therefor.
Section 12-1202 Application. An application for a license shall be made in conformity with the
general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses.
Section 12-1203 Sanitary Requirements. Every place wherein any business licensed under this
Article is carried on shall be kept in a clean and sanitary condition. All necessary measures shall be
taken to safeguard the lives and health of all persons employed in such establishments, and adequate
and convenient washing and toilet facilities shall be provided for employees. No person suffering
from an active contagious or infectious disease shall be employed in such business.
All articles kept for sale in such establishments shall be kept free from vermin or any matter of a
contagious or infectious nature.
All decomposed, fetid or putrescent matter and all refuse, waste and sweepings shall be removed and
disposed of at least once each day, and in such a manner as not to cause a nuisance. All cleaning
shall be done whenever possible after or before working hours, but if done during working hours, it
shall be done in such a manner as to avoid the unnecessary raising of dust or noxious material.

Article XIII Hardware and Paint Store Operators (Retail)
Section 12-1301 Definitions. The following terms shall have the meanings set forth below for
purposes of this Chapter.
a. Retail. Sales other than those for the purpose of resale or for use by manufacturers,
contractors, trades, railroads, public service corporations and institutions, or for the supplying
of branch or general establishments from a central depot or store, and shall not include the
sale at retail of second-hand or used goods, wares or commodities.
b. Retail hardware store. Any building, room, enclosure, premises, place, establishment or part
of an establishment in the Village, operated, maintained or conducted for the sale or offering
for sale at retail of any of the following articles: hardware; tinware; aluminumware;
enamelware; cutlery; tools; implements; apparatus; machinery, plumbing; engineers',
janitors', blacksmiths’, contractors', or electrical supplies; gas, plumbing or electrical fixtures;
other articles or wares made largely of metals; kerosene; rifles, shotguns and loaded shot
shells or cartridges where not more than 25,000 are kept on hand at one time; provided,
however, that dealers or establishments or parts of establishments of a similar nature
specifically defined and licensed by other parts of this Code shall be exempt from the
provisions of that part of this Article pertaining to retail hardware stores.
c. Retail paint store. Any building, room, enclosure, premises, place, establishment or part of an
establishment in the Village, operated or conducted for the sale or offering for sale at retail of
any paints, dry colors, wall paper, varnishes, calcimine, white or red lead, raw or boiled
linseed oil, turpentine, dryer, benzine, naphtha, painters' tools, supplies and equipment;
provided, however, that dealers or establishments or parts of establishments of a similar
nature specifically defined and licensed by other provisions of this Code shall be exempt
from the provisions of that part of this Article pertaining to paint stores.
Section 12-1302 License Required. No person shall engage in either the business of a retail
hardware store or a retail paint store without first having obtained a license therefor. Every person
licensed to engage in the business of a retail hardware store shall have the privilege of engaging in
the business of a retail paint store, within the same building, room, enclosure, premises, place,
establishment or part of an establishment without the necessity of obtaining an additional license.
Section 12-1303 Application. An application for a retail hardware store license or a retail paint
store license shall be made in conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to
applications for licenses.
Section 12-1304 Inspection. The Director of Building shall inspect or cause to be inspected as
often as deemed necessary, every retail hardware store and retail paint store in the Village to
determine whether all applicable provisions of this Code are being complied with. The Director of
Building shall have authority to require that such arrangements be made as may be necessary for the
safety and health of employees, pursuant to the provisions of this Code and such laws as maythen be
in force concerning health and sanitary conditions. The Fire Chief shall have authority to
require that such arrangements be made as may be necessary to comply with the fire regulations of
this Code.

Section 12-1305 Fire Prevention. It shall be the duty of every person licensed under this Article to
do business as a retail hardware store or a retail paint store to comply with the fire regulations of this
Code applicable thereto.
Section 12-1306 Ventilation. No owner, proprietor, manager, or superintendent of any business
licensed under this Article where one or more persons are employed shall cause, permit, or allow the
same, or any portion or apartment of any room within the same, to be overcrowded or inadequate,
faulty or insufficient in respect to light, ventilation, heat and cleanliness. Fresh air shall be supplied
by ventilation in accordance with the building regulations of this Code. No part of such air supply
shall be taken from any cellar or basement.

Article is carried on shall be kept in a clean and sanitary condition. All necessary measures shall be
taken to safeguard the lives and health of all persons employed in such establishments, and adequate
and convenient washing and toilet facilities shall be provided for such employees. No person
suffering from an active contagious or infectious disease shall be employed in such business. All
articles kept for sale in such establishments shall be kept free from vermin or any matter of a
contagious or infectious nature.
All refuse; waste and sweepings shall be removed and disposed of at least once each day, and in such
a manner as not to cause a nuisance. All cleaning shall be done whenever possible after or before
working hours, but if done during working hours, it shall be done in such a manner as to avoid the
unnecessary raising of dust or noxious material.

Article XIV Filling Station Operators
Section 12-1401 Definition. The term " filling station" when used in this Article shall mean any
building, structure, premises, enclosure or other place within the Village where a container or
containers, tank or tanks, either portable or stationary, and containing ether, carbon bisulphite,
gasoline, naphtha, benzole, hydrocarbon (gas drops), liquefied petroleum, gas, acetone, kerosene,
turpentine or other flammable liquids having a flash point below 165 degrees Fahrenheit, are kept or
located for the purpose of selling, offering for sale, or distributing any such liquids from such
container or tank; provided, however, that the provisions of this Article shall not apply to any place
where such flammable liquids are kept or sold for medicinal purposes only nor to a fuel oil dealer as
defined in Section 12-301 hereof.
Section 12-1402 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of a filling station
without first having obtained a license.
Section 12-1403 Application. An application for a license shall be made in conformity with the
general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses. The applicant shall also
specify the number of tanks installed on the licensed premises, whether such tanks are abandoned or
in use.
Ord. #04-077, #06-078)
Section 12-1404 Fee. The annual fee for each filling station shall be $160 per underground tank
used to store gasoline.
ARLINGTON HEIGHTS MUNICIPAL CODE
12-25 REVISED 04/04/16
Section 12-1405 Building and Fire Regulations. The construction, operation and maintenance of
filling stations and filling station equipment, including tanks, and the requirements for safety
clearances around same, shall be done in accordance with the provisions of this Code regulating
buildings, flammable liquids and fire prevention.
Section 12-1406 Inspections. The Director of Building and the Fire Chief shall inspect or cause to
be inspected as often as deemed necessary, every filling station in the Village to determine whether
all applicable provisions of this Code are being complied with.
Section 12-1407 Accessory Sales. The sale of milk, salt, ice and other foods and products shall be
permitted at filling stations. Milk must be stored in mechanical refrigerated cabinets that can be
maintained and cleaned inside and out. If milk is sold on the premises of a gasoline filling station,
all applicable provisions of the Village retail food store sanitation section of this Code must be met
and the equipment used in connection with such sales shall be inspected as often as deemed
necessary by the Village. Salt must be stored in an enclosed building or structure. The rental of
trucks, trailers and motorcycles shall be permitted only after the issuance of a special use permit as
provided in the zoning ordinance. The sale of new and used boats, automobiles and mobile homes is
prohibited.
Section 12-1408 Maintenance. All gasoline filling stations shall be maintained in a neat and
orderly manner and the storage or parking of abandoned or disabled vehicles on the premises is
prohibited.

Article XV Pet Shop Operators
Section 12-1501 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of a Pet Shop Operator
without first having obtained a business license. An application for a Pet Shop Operator’ s license
shall be made in conformity with this Article and the applicable general requirements of this Code
relating to applications for business licenses.
Section 12-1502 Definition. Pet Shop Operator, when used in this Article, shall mean any person
who sells, offers to sell, exchange, or offers for adoption with or without charge or donation dogs,
cats, birds, fish, reptiles, or other animals customarily obtained as pets in the Village. This does not
include those individuals who sell only those animals that they have produced and raised nor
veterinary hospitals or clinics operated by veterinarians licensed by the State of Illinois.
Section 12-1503 Application. An application for a Pet Shop Operator’ s license shall be made in
conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses. As
part of the application, the applicant shall provide a copy of their current Pet Shop Operator’ s license
issued by the Illinois Department of Agriculture.
Section 12-1504 Fee. The annual fee for Pet Shop Operator’ s license shall be as set forth in the
applicable provision of this Code setting forth business license fees.
Section 12-1505 Operation. Every Pet Shop Operator shall operate the business in full compliance
with this Article, as well as all State and Federal laws relating to animal health, sanitation, disease
prevention, as now or hereafter amended. All licensed premises shall be kept free and clear of
decaying food and filth of any kind and shall be maintained in a sanitary condition at all times.
MERCHANTS
12-26 REVISED 04/04/16
No person may sell, offer for sale, barter or give away as a pet or a novelty, any rabbit or fowl which
has been dyed, colored or otherwise treated to impart an artificial color thereto. Baby chicks or
ducklings shall not be sold, offered for sale, bartered or given away as pets or novelties.
Section 12-1506 Disclosures Required. Every Pet Shop Operator is required to post the information
set forth below on a Disclosure Statement for each dog and cat for sale in a location where they are
easily accessible, without request, by the public. If it will not be detrimental to the dog or cat, the
Disclosure Statement shall be placed on the animal’ s cage. If it is not in the best interests of the
animal to place the Disclosure Statement on an animal’ s cage, there shall be a notice on the cage
telling the customer where in the Pet Shop the Disclosure Statements can be found.
At the time of sale, the Disclosure Statement shall be provided by the Pet Shop Operator to the
customer in writing, with a statement that the information in the Disclosure Statement has been
determined by the Pet Shop Operator, in good faith, to be accurate. Both the Pet Shop Operator and
the customer shall sign the Disclosure Statement at the time of sale.
The Disclosure Statement shall include contact information for the Village’ s Building Department
for Code Enforcement purposes. The Pet Shop Operator shall retain the original signed Disclosure
Statement for a period of not less than two years from the date of sale. The signed Disclosure
Statements shall be made available for inspection by any Village employee authorized to make such
inspections.
The Disclosure Statement shall include, at a minimum, all of the following information:
a. The breed, approximate age, sex and color of the animal;
b. The date and description of any inoculation or medical treatment the animal has received
prior to or while in the care of the Pet Shop Operator;
c. The breeder’ s business name(s), mailing address, breeding location address if different
from the mailing address, as well as any other name and business address used by the
breeder for breeding purposes;
d. If the breeder is licensed by the United States Department of Agriculture, the current
license number, as well as any other license numbers held within the last five years;
e. A copy of the most recent USDA inspection report, updated quarterly and a link to the
USDA website so consumers can conduct their own due diligence on breeders;
f. Whether the breeder is a “ hobby breeder”, meaning the breeder has less than five female
dogs or cats, as applicable;
g. The average animal population for the prior six months by the breeder. This disclosure shall
be updated every six months and may be disclosed by category ranges for each type of
animal, dog or cat, as applicable: 0-25, 26-50, 51-75, and over 75;
h. The average number of female dogs or cats, as applicable, capable of reproduction for the
prior calendar six months by the breeder. This disclosure may be disclosed by category
ARLINGTON HEIGHTS MUNICIPAL CODE
12-27 REVISED 04/04/16
ranges for each type of animal, dog or cat, as applicable: 1-5, 6-25, 26-50, 51-75, and over
75;
i. The lineage (sire and dam) of the dog or cat;
j. The address of the location where the dog or cat was born, as well as the location(s)
where the dog or cat was housed after birth if different from the breeder’ s address as
listed in d. above; and
k. Any transfers of ownership of the dog or cat prior to its sale by a Village Pet Shop
Operator and, if the dog or cat was returned to the Pet Shop Operator by a customer, the
date the dog or cat was returned and the reason for the return.

Article XVI Kennels and Catteries
Section 12-1601 Definitions.
a. Dog kennel. Any establishment or premises wherein or whereon dogs are kept for the
purpose of breeding, boarding, sale, exchange or sporting.
b. Cattery. Any establishment or premises wherein or whereon cats are kept for the purpose of
breeding, boarding, sale, exchange or sporting.
Section 12-1602 License Required. No person shall engage in the business of operating a dog
kennel or a cattery without first having obtained a license therefor.
In cases where the business of buying, selling or dealing in birds, dogs and other small animals used
as household pets or for domestic purposes is conducted, or carried on in connection with the
business of a dog kennel or a cattery in the same premises, and by the same person, then only one
license need be obtained, and that license shall be that which requires the payment of the highest
license fee under either of the two license provisions of this Code.
Any person licensed to operate a kennel shall be exempt from the payment of the dog registry fee for
each and every dog which is kept in any licensed kennel.
Section 12-1603 Application. An application for a license shall be made in conformity with the
general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses. Such application shall also
state the number of animals which it is proposed to keep in the establishment or premises for which
application for license is made.
Section 12-1604 Removal of Dog or Cat. No dog or cat shall be permitted to stray or to be taken
anywhere outside the limits of the kennel or cattery, unless such animal is on leash or is taken out
temporarily for the purpose of hunting, breeding, trial, show or exhibition.
Section 12-1605 Sanitary Provisions. All dog kennels and catteries shall be kept free and clean
from decaying food and filth of any kind. Surfaces shall be non-absorbent and easily cleanable. The
kennels, buildings and pens shall be painted or disinfected from time to time and shall be kept in a
MERCHANTS

sanitary condition satisfactory to the Director of Building and Director of Health Services and to
ensure a safe and sanitary environment for animals and employees.
Section 12-1606 Inspection. The Director of Building shall cause to be inspected the business
premises and operations licensed under this Article as often as deemed necessary to determine
whether all applicable provisions of this Code are being complied with.

Article XVII Itinerant Dealers and Stands
Ord. #02-018)
Section 12-1701 Definition. "Itinerant dealer," when used in this Article, shall mean any person
engaged in the business of buying or selling tangible objects within the Village who has not
established a permanent place of business within the Village from which such operation has been
carried on for a period of at least 90 days prior to the first sale or purchase of such objects. Any
person who wishes to buy or sell such objects from a permanent place of business shall not be
subject to the provisions of this Ordinance upon a presentation to the Village Manager of a bona fide
lease for a period of at least one year for permanent premises within the Village.
Ord. #02-018)
Section 12-1702 License Required. No person shall engage in the business as an itinerant dealer
within the Village without first having obtained a license therefor.

conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses.
Ord. #03-078, # 06-078)

the Village.
Ord. #02-018)
Section 12-1705 Records. Every itinerant dealer doing business in the Village shall keep a record
of every article received, purchased, sold or exchanged setting forth the following: the date of the
transaction, name and address of the purchaser or seller, and a brief description of the article sold,
purchased, received or exchanged, including identification number thereon, if any. Such record and
the articles themselves shall, at all reasonable times, be open to the inspection of any police officer.
Section 12-1706 Stolen Goods. It shall be the duty of every person licensed under the provisions of
this Article to report to the police any article received or offered which that person has reason to
believe was stolen or lost.

resale or for reconditioning for resale are not Garage Sales and are prohibited.

Article XIXHome Rule Municipal Retailers' Occupation and Service Occupation Tax
Ord. #03-077, #09-036)
Section 12-1901 Home Rule Municipal Retailers' Occupation and Service Occupation Tax. A
tax is hereby imposed upon all persons engaged in the business of selling tangible personal property,
other than an item of tangible personal property titled or registered with an agency of this State's
government, at the rate of 1% of the gross receipts from sales made in the course of business while
this Section is in effect; and a tax is hereby imposed upon all persons engaged in this Municipality in
the business of making sales of service, at the rate of1% of the selling price of all tangible personal
property transferred by such service people as an incident to a sale of service. This Home Rule
Municipal Retailers' Occupation Tax and HomeRule Municipal Service Occupation Tax shall not be
applicable on the sales of food for human consumption which is to be consumed off the premises
where it is sold (other than alcoholic beverages, soft drinks and food which has been prepared for
immediate consumption) and prescription and non-prescription medicines, drugs, medical appliances
and insulin, urine testing materials and syringes and needles used by diabetics. The imposition of
these home rule taxes is in accordance with the provision of 65 ILCS 5/8-11-1 and 65 ILCS 5/8-11-5,
as amended.
Article XX Penalties
Section 12-2001 Penalties. Any person violating any of the provisions of this Chapter shall be
fined not less than $5 nor more than $750 for each offense. A separate offense shall be deemed
committed on each day during or in which a violation occurs or continues.
